/circle6 Refer her to the MO for further management.
Pre-term labour
Pre-term labour is defi ned as the onset of labour prior to the completion of 37 weeks 
of gestation.
/circle6 If the delivery is not imminent, i.e. there is enough time to transport the woman, refer 
her to the FRU. Th is is because the newborn may need specialised care, which might not 
be possible at the domiciliary level/SC.
/circle6 If the delivery is imminent, perform the delivery and refer the woman and baby
